de.mrapp.android.preference

Class DialogPreference

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.preference.Preference
      • de.mrapp.android.preference.Preference
        • de.mrapp.android.preference.DialogPreference
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnKeyListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnShowListener, java.lang.Comparable<androidx.preference.Preference>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractColorPickerPreference, AbstractListPreference, AbstractNumberPickerPreference, AbstractValidateableDialogPreference, SeekBarPreference

    public class DialogPreference
extends Preference
implements android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnShowListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnKeyListener
    An abstract base class for all preferences, which will show a dialog when clicked by the user.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DialogPreference.SavedState
      A data structure, which allows to save the internal state of an DialogPreference.

        androidx.preference.Preference.BaseSavedState, androidx.preference.Preference.OnPreferenceChangeListener, androidx.preference.Preference.OnPreferenceClickListener

    • Constructor Detail

      • DialogPreference

        public DialogPreference(@NonNull
                        android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new preference, which will show a dialog when clicked by the user.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • DialogPreference

        public DialogPreference(@NonNull
                        android.content.Context context,
                        @Nullable
                        android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a new preference, which will show a dialog when clicked by the user.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available

      • DialogPreference

        public DialogPreference(@NonNull
                        android.content.Context context,
                        @Nullable
                        android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                        @AttrRes
                        int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new preference, which will show a dialog when clicked by the user.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • DialogPreference

        public DialogPreference(@NonNull
                        android.content.Context context,
                        @Nullable
                        android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                        @AttrRes
                        int defaultStyle,
                        @StyleRes
                        int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new preference, which will show a dialog when clicked by the user.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

    • Method Detail

      • createDialogBuilder

        @NonNull
protected de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder<?,?> createDialogBuilder(@StyleRes
                                                                                                           int dialogTheme)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses when the builder, which is used to configure the preference's dialog, is about to be created.
        Parameters:
        dialogTheme - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The builder, which has been created, as an instance of the class AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder. The builder may not be null

      • createDialog

        @NonNull
protected de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractButtonBarDialog createDialog(@NonNull
                                                                                de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder<?,?> dialogBuilder)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses when the preference's dialog is about to be created. The builder, which is passed as a method parameter may be manipulated by subclasses in order to change the appearance of the dialog. When views are inflated inside this method, the context of the builder should be used in order to ensure that the dialog's theme is used.
        Parameters:
        dialogBuilder - The builder, which is used to create the preference's dialog, as an instance of the class AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder
        Returns:
        The dialog, which has been created, as an instance of the class AbstractButtonBarDialog. The dialog may not be null

      • needInputMethod

        protected boolean needInputMethod()
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses to determine, whether the soft input mode should be requested when the preference's dialog becomes shown, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the soft input mode should be requested when the preference's dialog becomes shown, false otherwise

      • onPrepareDialog

        protected void onPrepareDialog(@NonNull
                               de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder<?,?> dialogBuilder)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses when the preference's dialog is about to be created. The builder, which is passed as a method parameter may be manipulated by subclasses in order to change the appearance of the dialog. When views are inflated inside this method, the context of the builder should be used in order to ensure that the dialog's theme is used.
        Parameters:
        dialogBuilder - The builder, which is used to create the preference's dialog, as an instance of the class AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder

      • onDialogClosed

        protected void onDialogClosed(boolean positiveResult)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses when the preference's dialog has been closed. This method may be used within subclasses to evaluate the changes, which have been made while the dialog was shown.
        Parameters:
        positiveResult - True, if the dialog has been close affirmatively, false otherwise

      • getDialog

        @Nullable
public final android.app.Dialog getDialog()
        Returns the dialog, which is shown by the preference.
        Returns:
        The dialog, which is shown by the preference, as an instance of the class Dialog or null, if the dialog is currently not shown

      • isDialogShown

        public final boolean isDialogShown()
        Returns, whether the preference's dialog is currently shown, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the preference's dialog is currently shown, false otherwise

      • isDialogFullscreen

        public final boolean isDialogFullscreen()
        Returns, whether the preference's dialog is shown fullscreen, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the preference's dialog is shown fullscreen, false otherwise

      • setDialogFullscreen

        public final void setDialogFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
        Sets, whether the preference's dialog should be shown fullscreen, or not.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen - True, if the preference's dialog should be shown fullscreen, false otherwise

      • getDialogGravity

        public final int getDialogGravity()
        Returns the gravity of the preference's dialog.
        Returns:
        The gravity of the preference's dialog as an Integer value or -1, if the default gravity is used. The gravity consists of the flags given in Dialog.Gravity

      • setDialogGravity

        public final void setDialogGravity(int gravity)
        Sets the gravity of the preference's dialog.
        Parameters:
        gravity - The gravity, which should be set, as an Integer value or -1, if the default gravity should be used. The gravity must consist of the flags given in Dialog.Gravity

      • getDialogWidth

        public final int getDialogWidth()
        Returns the width of the preference's dialog.
        Returns:
        The width of the preference's dialog in pixels as an Integer value or Dialog#MATCH_PARENT, respectively Dialog#WRAP_CONTENT or 0, if the default width is used

      • setDialogWidth

        public final void setDialogWidth(int width)
        Sets the width of the preference's dialog.
        Parameters:
        width - The width, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value or Dialog#MATCH_PARENT, respectively Dialog#WRAP_CONTENT or 0, if the default width should be used

      • getDialogHeight

        public final int getDialogHeight()
        Returns the height of the preference's dialog.
        Returns:
        The height of the preference's dialog in pixels as an Integer value or Dialog#MATCH_PARENT, respectively Dialog#WRAP_CONTENT or 0, if the default height is used

        Parameters:

        public final void setDialogMaxWidth(int maxWidth)
        Sets the maximum width of the preference's dialog.
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - The maximum width, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The maximum width must be at least 1, or -1, if no maximum width should be set

        Returns the maximum height of the preference's dialog.
        Returns:

      • setDialogMargin

        public final void setDialogMargin(int left,
                                  int top,
                                  int right,
                                  int bottom)
        Sets the margin of the preference's dialog.
        Parameters:
        left - The left margin, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The left margin must be at least 0
        top - The left margin, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The left margin must be at least 0
        right - The left margin, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The left margin must be at least 0
        bottom - The left margin, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The left margin must be at least 0

      • isDialogFitsSystemWindowsLeft

        public final boolean isDialogFitsSystemWindowsLeft()
        Returns, whether the preference's dialog accounts for system screen decorations such as the status bar and insets its content at the left edge.
        Returns:
        True, if the preference's dialog insets its content at the left edge, false otherwise

      • isDialogFitsSystemWindowsTop

        public final boolean isDialogFitsSystemWindowsTop()
        Returns, whether the preference's dialog accounts for system screen decorations such as the status bar and insets its content at the top edge.
        Returns:
        True, if the preference's dialog insets its content at the top edge, false otherwise

      • isDialogFitsSystemWindowsRight

        public final boolean isDialogFitsSystemWindowsRight()
        Returns, whether the preference's dialog accounts for system screen decorations such as the status bar and insets its content at the right edge.
        Returns:
        True, if the preference's dialog insets its content at the right edge, false otherwise

      • isDialogFitsSystemWindowsBottom

        public final boolean isDialogFitsSystemWindowsBottom()
        Returns, whether the preference's dialog accounts for system screen decorations such as the status bar and insets its content at the bottom edge.
        Returns:
        True, if the preference's dialog insets its content at the bottom edge, false otherwise

      • setDialogFitsSystemWindows

        public final void setDialogFitsSystemWindows(boolean fitsSystemWindows)
        Sets, whether the preference's dialog should account for system screen decorations such as the status bar and inset its content, or not.
        Parameters:
        fitsSystemWindows - True, if the preference's dialog should inset its content, false otherwise

      • setDialogFitsSystemWindows

        public final void setDialogFitsSystemWindows(boolean left,
                                             boolean top,
                                             boolean right,
                                             boolean bottom)
        Sets, whether the preference's dialog should account for system screen decorations such as the status bar and inset its content, or not.
        Parameters:
        left - True, if the preference's dialog should inset its content at the left edge, false otherwise
        top - True, if the preference's dialog should inset its content at the top edge, false otherwise
        right - True, if the preference's dialog should inset its content at the right edge, false otherwise
        bottom - True, if the preference's dialog should inset its content at the bottom edge, false otherwise

      • setDialogScrollableArea

        public final void setDialogScrollableArea(@Nullable
                                          de.mrapp.android.dialog.ScrollableArea.Area top,
                                          @Nullable
                                          de.mrapp.android.dialog.ScrollableArea.Area bottom)
        Sets the scrollable area of the preference's dialog.
        Parameters:
        top - The top scrollable area, which should be set, as a value of the enum Area or null, if no scrollable area should be set
        bottom - The bottom scrollable area, which should be set, as a value of the enum Area or null, if no scrollable area should be set. The index of the bottom area must be at leas the index of the top area. If the top area is null, the bottom area must be null as well

        view - The custom view, which should be set, as an instance of the class View or null, if no custom view should be set

        Parameters:

      • setOnDismissListener

                                       android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the preference's dialog has been dismissed.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnDismissListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setOnCancelListener

        public final void setOnCancelListener(@Nullable
                                      android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the preference's dialog has been canceled.

        The listener will only be invoked, when the dialog is canceled. Cancel events alone will not capture all ways that the dialog might be dismissed. If the creator needs to know when a dialog is dismissed in general, use setOnDismissListener(android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener).

        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnCancelListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setOnKeyListener

        public final void setOnKeyListener(@Nullable
                                   android.content.DialogInterface.OnKeyListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when a key has been dispatched to the preference's dialog.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnKeyListener or null, if no listener should be notified
